page.title: 12Continuation of page 11
page.content: and pilgrims used to come to the shrine of saint William_In_The_Wood. The chapel stands in the centre of a large open space. One can see four stone stumps set in a square. They mark out an area of about 2 acres. No vegetation grows on the site of the chapel. People used to say that this was because it was holy-land but the fact is that the plants would not grow because of the flints. Beside the chapel is the monks burial ground. This was found in the Second World War A bomb dropped on the corner of the piece of land making a large dip. In this were found the bones of some people, presumably the monks, but at any rate it was definately a burial ground.Now it is a leisure area. Mousehold takes up only 184 acres now. The name Mousehold means "mouse infested holt(Forest)".
